data.description: ECB's President Lagarde ends press conference in Florence.
Reports in Israel: A protester fell to his death from a building roof in Jerusalem.

data.title: Space-based laser communication market growing at 16.5% CAGR due to demand for high-speed satellite data links and reliable transmission.
data.description: The Space-based Laser Communication Market is experiencing significant growth due to the increasing demand for fast, secure, and dependable data transfer within satellite networks. This growth is propelled by the rising deployment of small satellites, a growing need for broadband connectivity, and a transition towards optical technology. These factors have led to a surge in market demand, with global revenues expected to reach substantial figures in the near future.

data.title: Fiserv, Inc. reports downbeat Q3 results, cuts 2026 earnings guidance by around 30%. Analysts turn bearish, with notable target price reductions.
data.description: Stocks of Fiserv Inc (NYSE: FI) continued to decrease following the company's announcement of disappointing third-quarter results. Analysis from various experts revealed significant shifts in their ratings and price targets. Goldman Sachs analyst Will Nance revised the rating from Buy to Neutral and reduced the price target from $149 to $79. BTIG analyst Andrew Harte also downgraded the rating from Buy to Neutral, while Seaport Research Partners analyst Jeff Cantwell made a similar adjustment. The company's latest earnings update included a 30% reduction in its 2026 guidance, a move that caught analysts off guard. Fiserv's management emphasized short-term strategies for enhancing revenue growth, which raised concerns among investors. More details are accessible on Benzinga.com.

data.title: TotalEnergies Q3 earnings miss street estimates, with $1.77 EPS and $48.69B revenue, up 11% to $3.98B net income.
data.description: TotalEnergies SE (NYSE: TTE) stocks saw a decline as the company announced its third-quarter 2025 earnings, falling short of street estimates. The French energy giant reported adjusted earnings of $1.77 per share, below the anticipated $1.81. Revenue for the quarter was $48.69 billion, missing expectations of $54.93 billion. Adjusted net income stood at $3.98 billion, marking an 11% increase from the previous quarter. Adjusted EBITDA rose by 6% quarter-over-quarter to $10.3 billion. Cash flow from operations, excluding working capital changes, amounted to $7.1 billion in the quarter. In the Exploration & Production segment, the company generated $2.17 billion. TotalEnergies recently secured a significant deal in Saudi Arabia for a 400 MW Solar Power project.

data.title: Arize AI and Infogain team up to enhance enterprise AI with Ignis platform, boosting scalability and reliability.
data.description: Infogain and Arize have teamed up in a collaboration that merges Infogain's consulting and delivery skills with Arize's vendor-agnostic AI engineering and observability platform. This partnership aims to operationalize trustworthy and scalable AI systems. The collaboration was announced in Berkeley, California on October 30, 2025. Arize AI, known for its AI observability and LLM evaluations, will benefit from Infogain's expertise in consulting and delivery, enhancing the capabilities of both companies in the AI industry.

data.title: Coinbase (NASDAQ: COIN) to release earnings; analysts predict $1.1/share, $1.8B revenue. Shares fell 1.9% to $348.61.
data.description: Coinbase Global, Inc. is set to report its third-quarter earnings on Oct. 30 after the market closes. Analysts are predicting earnings of $1.1 per share, a significant increase from the 28 cents per share reported in the same period last year. Revenue for the quarter is expected to be around $1.8 billion, up from $1.21 billion a year ago. The company has missed revenue estimates for two consecutive quarters but has surpassed them in seven out of the last 10 quarters. Closing at $348.61 on Wednesday, Coinbase shares experienced a 1.9% decline. For more detailed information, visit the Benzinga website, where readers can find the latest analyst ratings.

data.title: SpaceX shifts $894M Bitcoin holding, reason unclear. No explanation from Elon Musk’s company yet.
data.description: SpaceX, the company owned by Elon Musk, is making changes to its security system. It is unclear whether the company is selling or restructuring its security measures. However, SpaceX is actively engaging with Bitcoin, with recent developments indicating its involvement in the cryptocurrency. Further details on the extent of the changes and implications for the company remain undisclosed.

data.title: Stay informed about scams to protect personal information. Scammers stole $12.5 billion in 2024 according to the FTC.
data.description: Discover strategies to protect your sensitive data from scammers in Washington, as scammers pilfered approximately $12.5 billion from consumers in 2024, as stated by the FTC. Beware of scams across various platforms like emails, text messages, phone calls, social media, and payment applications. Stay vigilant and safeguard your personal information against potential threats.

data.title: Howmet Aerospace surpasses estimates with $2.089 billion revenue, 95 cents EPS. Quarter results lead to 14% revenue increase.
data.description: Howmet Aerospace Inc. reported record third-quarter 2025 results with adjusted earnings per share of 95 cents (beating estimates of 91 cents) and revenue of $2.089 billion (surpassing the $2.042 billion estimate). Revenue increased 14% year over year, led by a 15% jump in commercial aerospace, 24% in defense aerospace, and 18% in industrial and other markets. Operating income and adjusted operating income both increased to $542 million, representing a 29% year-over-year increase. Adjusted EBITDA excluding special items rose 26% year over year to $614 million, with margins improving to 29.4%. The company generated $531 million in cash from operations.

data.title: P.C. Richard & Son, retailer open 116 years, remains closed on Thanksgiving to honor employees and tradition.
data.description: In Farmingdale, NY, on October 30, 2025, P.C. Richard & Son, the largest family-owned retailer in America specializing in appliances, electronics, and mattresses, has reiterated its dedication to prioritizing employees, family values, and holiday customs. The company, consisting of 63 locations, confirms its unwavering commitment for another year.
US House Speaker Johnson: There is no legal mechanism to use contingency funds for snap.

data.title: Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolic Diseases Market projected to reach USD 451.87 billion by 2033, from USD 298.73 billion in 2024.
data.description: In October 30, 2025, it was reported that the market for cardiovascular, renal, and metabolic diseases had grown significantly, reaching US$298.73 billion in 2024 from US$286.12 billion in the previous year. Projections suggest that this market will continue to expand, with an estimated value of US$451.87 billion by 2033.

data.title: Van Wagner introduces new division Van Wagner X for corporate events, aiming to enhance engagement in live events.
data.description: On October 30, 2025, a prominent company in sports and live event production, Van Wagner, unveiled its latest venture, Van Wagner X. This new division aims to cater specifically to the increasing need for enhanced engagement from organizations and businesses. With a strong global presence, the company is set to leverage its expertise to meet this demand innovatively. The launch of Van Wagner X signals a strategic move by the industry leader, highlighting their dedication to adapt to evolving market requirements and offer tailored solutions.

data.title: Global condom market projected to grow at 8.9% during 2026-2032, driven by rising sexual health awareness - MarkNtel Advisors.
data.description: In New Delhi on October 30, 2025, a recent study by MarkNtel Advisors revealed a notable surge in the global Condom Market. This growth is attributed to heightened awareness on sexual health and the prevention of sexually transmitted infections (STIs). The market is currently experiencing substantial expansion, driven by factors such as growing public consciousness about the importance of safe sexual practices. As per the analysis, key figures indicate a promising trajectory for the market with increasing demand for condoms worldwide.

data.title: LG Ad Solutions introduces Agentiv, AI advertising platform for CTV with data-driven efficiencies. CTO mentions focus on responsible AI integration.
data.description: LG Ad Solutions, headquartered in Mountain View, California, revealed the launch of Agentiv, an AI platform for CTV advertising technology. The global provider introduced this platform to improve operational and data efficiencies through internal and external agents. Dave Rudnick, Chief Technology Officer at LG Ad Solutions, highlighted their emphasis on establishing the necessary data infrastructure for the responsible integration of AI into their advertising technology.

data.title: Core Scientific cancels merger with CoreWeave due to lack of shareholder approval.
data.description: In Austin, Texas, Core Scientific, Inc. (NASDAQ: CORZ), a prominent player in digital infrastructure for high-density colocation services and digital asset mining, disclosed that at a recent special stockholders' meeting, the Company fell short of the votes required to authorize the proposed merger deal with CoreWeave, Inc. This announcement came after a prior declaration was made about the agreement between the two entities. The decision was reached on October 30, 2025, adhering to the terms stipulated in the merger agreement.
